bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Financial Institutions Act.
In addition to its responsibilities and duties under the Act, the council must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: maintain books of account in a form and in a manner that facilitate the preparation of its financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles,
prepare financial statements annually in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles,
before June 1 of each year, appoint a person qualified under sections 205 and 206 of the Business Corporations Act as auditor of the council for the following fiscal year,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: no later than September 30 of each year, the financial statements for the previous fiscal year and a copy of the auditor's report, and
at least 60 days before the beginning of each fiscal year, a copy of its proposed budget for that year,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make a copy of the council's financial statements for the previous fiscal year available to the public,
collect on behalf of the government the fees referred to in items 18, 18.1 and 19 of Schedule 1 to the Financial Institutions Fees Regulation, and
provide a continuing education program for general insurance agents, general insurance salespersons, life insurance agents, insurance adjusters and employed insurance adjusters.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The council is authorized, for the purpose of funding its expenses, to set by order and collect, from insurers authorized to carry on insurance business, an assessment in an amount for each such insurer that is not more than 10Â times the highest maximum amount of a fee established by rule of the council for the annual fee for an insurance agent's licence.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Financial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141, s. 289.]
